column1: The life of a pelican seems to be a very lazy
column2: if not a very pleasant one. Man
column3: ever on the watch to turn the habits of animals to his own account
column4: observing how good a fisherman the pelican is
column6: and makes him fish for him. I have heard of a bird of this kind in America
column8: that it would at command go off in the morning
column9: and return at night with its pouch full
column10: and stretched to the utmost; part of its treasure it disgorged for its master
column11: the rest was given to the bird for its trouble. It is hardly credible what these extraordinary pouches will hold; it is said
column13: a man's leg with the boots on was once found in one of them.Pelicans live in flocks; they and the cormorants sometimes help one another to get a living. The cormorant is a species of pelican
column14: of a dusky color: it is sometimes called the sea crow.
